info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 8 at 7:34PM EDT until June 11 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis IN
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Indianapolis IN has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Indiana...
Wildcat Creek near Lafayette.
.Rainfall amounts within the past few days of two to four inches across central Indiana is producing minor flooding along Wildcat Creek. Additional rainfall of up to an inch is possible through Monday night.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Wildcat Creek near Lafayette.
* WHEN...From this evening to early Wednesday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Flooding of lowland areas in progress in portions of Tippecanoe County.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:45 PM EDT Sunday the stage was 10.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:45 PM EDT Sunday was 10.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 10.9 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage Tuesday evening. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind.
The next statement should be issued Monday morning by around 1045 AM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO EARLY WEDNESDAY MORNING
